alerts.message:
...A Severe Thunderstorm Warning remains in effect until 645 PM CDT
for western Roger Mills County...

At 622 PM CDT...severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 7 miles northwest of Cheyenne to 7 miles southeast of
Allison...moving northeast at 25 mph.

Hazard...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. 

Source...radar indicated. 

Impact...expect damage to roofs...siding...and trees. 

Locations impacted include...
Reydon...roll...Crawford and Dempsey. 

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms...and may lead to
flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.


Lat...Lon 3549 9978 3545 10000 3580 10000 3590 9979
 3589 9978 3588 9975 3586 9972 3585 9967
 3568 9966
time...Mot...loc 2322z 241deg 24kt 3568 9978 3552 10001 

Hail...0.88in
wind...60mph
 

Brb

The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
 southern Roger Mills County in western Oklahoma...

* until 815 PM CDT

* at 608 PM CDT...Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to
 thunderstorms. Radar estimates that one and a half inches of rain
 has fallen in less than an hour just south of Cheyenne and
 additional thunderstorms will move through southern Roger Mills
 County. This heavy rain will cause minor flooding in the advisory
 area.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
 Cheyenne...Hammon...Reydon and Dempsey. 

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams...low water crossings...highways...streets and as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Turn
around...don't drown.

Lat...Lon 3568 10000 3565 9938 3555 9938 3555 9937
 3551 9937 3551 9958 3550 9958 3551 10000


..speg.
